1.verse: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy [ a ] our brother, to Philemon our beloved and fellow-worker,

2.verse: and to Apphia [ b ] our sister, and to Archippus our fellow-soldier, and to the church in thy house:

3.verse: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: I thank my God always, making mention of thee in my prayers,

5.verse: hearing of [ c ] thy love, and of the faith which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all the saints;

6.verse: that the fellowship of thy faith may become effectual, in the knowledge of every good thing which is in [ d ] you, unto Christ.

7.verse: For I had much joy and comfort in thy love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through thee, brother.

8.verse: Wherefore, though I have all boldness in Christ to enjoin thee that which is befitting,

9.verse: yet for loveâ€™s sake I rather beseech, being such a one as Paul [ e ] the aged, and now a prisoner also of Christ Jesus:

10.verse: I beseech thee for my child, whom I have begotten in my bonds, [ f ] Onesimus,

11.verse: who once was unprofitable to thee, but now is profitable to thee and to me:

12.verse: whom I have sent back to thee in his own person, that is, my very heart:

13.verse: whom I would fain have kept with me, that in thy behalf he might minister unto me in the bonds of the [ g ] gospel:

14.verse: but without thy mind I would do nothing; that thy goodness should not be as of necessity, but of free will.

15.verse: For perhaps he was therefore parted from thee for a season, that thou shouldest have him for ever;

16.verse: no longer as a [ h ] servant, but more than a [ i ] servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much rather to thee, both in the flesh and in the Lord.

17.verse: If then thou countest me a partner, receive him as myself.

18.verse: But if he hath wronged thee at all, or oweth thee aught, put that to mine account;

19.verse: I Paul write it with mine own hand, I will repay it: that I say not unto thee that thou owest to me even thine own self besides.

20.verse: Yea, brother, let me have [ j ] joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my heart in Christ.

21.verse: Having confidence in thine obedience I write unto thee, knowing that thou wilt do even beyond what I say.

22.verse: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I hope that through your prayers I shall be granted unto you.

23.verse: Epaphras, my fellow-prisoner in Christ Jesus, saluteth thee;

24.verse: and so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, Luke, my fellow-workers.

25.verse: The grace of [ k ] our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. [ l ] Amen.
